answerText: triangles [10] If you don't know the height, you can drop a perpendicular and solve for it using this law on one of the smaller triangles. This law states that the ratio of side length to a certain function of the opposite angle is equal for all sides.

question: Question: Euler's line connects the orthocenter of these shapes with two of their other centers.  [10] Name these shapes whose area is one half the product of their base and height.
